content.description:
Monster Magnet's popularity has suffered because most people would rather succeed on

CHUD

, a soft 13a, than flail on a brutal 12d.    Beyond ratings, this route has amazing rock, great movement, and is one of the best bouldery 12+ routes in the canyon.  If this thing ever gets bumped to 13a, it will see more ascents.

Short and powerful, Monster Magnet packs the majority of its difficulty into a devious 20 foot V7 boulder problem.  Enjoy a small rest, and then navigate through some pumpy slopers, sidepulls and pinches to the top.
content.protection: Five quickdraws plus 2 for the anchor.  Since the anchor consist of a hanger, and an eye bolt, you may want to bring a leaver biner for the hanger so you can lower off 2 bolts.  A 50 meter rope will easily get you back to the ground.
content.location:
Left of

CHUD

, Monster Magnet is the middle bolt line and starts in a small, left-facing, layback feature.

content.description: Not the best route in Rifle but definitely worth a try, this unnamed route is great for those who are trying to avoid the crowds, want something unpolished, or have done everything else.
content.protection: Five quickdraws, plus 2 for the anchors.  To lower off the anchors, you will need at least a 50 meter rope.
content.location:
Two routes left of

CHUD

, this route starts in a large, left-facing corner that is capped by a roof at 15 feet.

content.description: The crux is on the 3rd move.  You undercling the top of the big jug and get a really high foot just to the left of the jug and crank up the the sidepull/undercling 4 feet above that.  The rest of the route is 5.11-5.12.  Its a one move wonder!  This route is about 50-75 yards to the left of Feline.
content.protection: It is possible to clip every draw on this route from the tree that runs right along behind the climb.  There is no danger of hitting this tree from the route, but with a stick clip the rock is 5-6 feet from the rock.  The rock is better on this climb than any other climb at Rifle!
